00010 // The base class for all Pulse Sub Records. Currently, however, this data
00011 // is not stored in the Event classes because we don't read directly from the Samba files
00012 // at the moment. This will possibly change one day in the future.

00021 KMCBolometerRecord::KMCBolometerRecord(void)
00022 {
00023         InitializeMembers();
00024         
00025         //we must take care of members on the heap outside of 
00026         //InitializeMembers...
00027         fParticleName=0;
00028         fParticleNameSize=0;
00029         
00030         fProcess=0;
00031         fProcessSize=0;
00032         
00033         fCreationProcess=0;
00034         fCreationProcessSize=0;
00035         
00036 }

00053 KMCBolometerRecord& KMCBolometerRecord::operator=(const KMCBolometerRecord &aRec)
00054 {
00055         if(&aRec == this) return *this;
00056         
00057         this->KSubRecord::operator=(aRec);
00058         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00059         
00060         
00061         
00062         return *this;
00063 }

00065 void KMCBolometerRecord::CopyLocalMembers(const KMCBolometerRecord &aRec)
00066 {
00067         SetEventID(aRec.GetEventID()) ;
00068         SetTrackID(aRec.GetTrackID()) ;
00069         SetParentID(aRec.GetParentID()) ;
00070         SetTime(aRec.GetTime());
00071         SetEnergy(aRec.GetEnergy());
00072         SetRecoilEnergy(aRec.GetRecoilEnergy());
00073         SetParticleName(aRec.GetParticleName().c_str(), aRec.GetParticleName().length()) ;
00074         SetProcess(aRec.GetProcess().c_str(), aRec.GetProcess().length()) ;
00075         SetCreationProcess(aRec.GetCreationProcess().c_str(), aRec.GetCreationProcess().length());
00076         SetXpos(aRec.GetXpos());
00077         SetYpos(aRec.GetYpos());
00078         SetZpos(aRec.GetZpos());
00079         SetMCQvalue(aRec.GetMCQvalue());
00080 }

00090 void KMCBolometerRecord::Clear(Option_t *opt)
00091 {
00092         //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00093   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00094   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00095   //inside of a TClonesArray
00096   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00097   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00098         KHLABolometerRecord::Clear(opt);
00099         
00100  
00101         //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00102         if(fParticleName!=0){
00103                 delete[] fParticleName;
00104                 fParticleName=0;
00105                 fParticleNameSize=0;
00106         }
00107         
00108         if(fProcess!=0){
00109                 delete[] fProcess;
00110                 fProcess=0;
00111                 fProcessSize=0;
00112         }
00113         
00114         if(fCreationProcess!=0){
00115                 delete[] fCreationProcess;
00116                 fCreationProcess=0;
00117                 fCreationProcessSize=0;
00118         }
00119         
00120   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00121          InitializeMembers();
00122         
00123 }
00124 
00125 void KMCBolometerRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00126 {
00127         //init local members
00128         
00129   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00130   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00131         SetEventID(-99) ;
00132         SetTrackID(-99) ;
00133         SetParentID(-99) ;
00134         SetNumHits(-99) ;
00135         SetTime(-99);
00136         SetEnergy(-99);
00137         SetRecoilEnergy(-99);
00138         /*SetParticleName("-99",3) ;
00139         SetProcess("-99",3) ;
00140         SetCreationProcess("-99",3);*/
00141         SetXpos(-99);
00142         SetYpos(-99);
00143         SetZpos(-99);
00144         SetMCQvalue(-99);
00145         
00146 }
00147 
00148 void KMCBolometerRecord::SetParticleName(const Char_t* aWord, Int_t aSize)
00149 {
00150         if(aSize!=fParticleNameSize){
00151                 if(fParticleName!=0){
00152                         delete[] fParticleName; 
00153                         fParticleName=0;
00154                         fParticleNameSize=0;
00155                 }
00156                 if(aSize>0)fParticleName= new Char_t[aSize];
00157                 fParticleNameSize=aSize;
00158         }
00159         if(aSize>0)memcpy(fParticleName, aWord, fParticleNameSize*sizeof(Char_t));
00160 }
00161 
00162 void KMCBolometerRecord::SetProcess(const Char_t* aWord, Int_t aSize)
00163 {
00164         if(aSize!=fProcessSize){
00165                 if(fProcess!=0){
00166                         delete[] fProcess;      
00167                         fProcess=0;
00168                         fProcessSize=0;
00169                 }
00170                 if(aSize>0)fProcess= new Char_t[aSize];
00171                 fProcessSize=aSize;
00172         }
00173         if(aSize>0)memcpy(fProcess, aWord, fProcessSize*sizeof(Char_t));
00174 }

00176 void KMCBolometerRecord::SetCreationProcess(const Char_t* aWord, Int_t aSize)

00192 Bool_t KMCBolometerRecord::IsSame(const KMCBolometerRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00193 {
00194         //Compares two objects and their member variables to test for equality.
00195         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00196         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00197         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00198         
00199         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00200         
00201         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00202         if(!this->KSubRecord::IsSame(aRec,bPrint)){
00203                 bIsEqual = false;
00204                 if(!bPrint)
00205                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00206                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00207         }
00208         
00209         if(fEventID != aRec.fEventID){
00210                 if (bPrint) 
00211                         cout << "KMCBolometerRecord fEventID Not Equal. lhs: " 
00212                         << fEventID << " != rhs " << aRec.fEventID << endl;             
00213                 bIsEqual = false;
00214                 if(!bPrint)
00215                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00216                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00217         }
00218         
00219         if(fTrackID != aRec.fTrackID){
00220                 if (bPrint) 
00221                         cout << "KMCBolometerRecord fTrackID Not Equal. lhs: " 
00222                         << fTrackID << " != rhs " << aRec.fTrackID << endl;             
00223                 bIsEqual = false;
00224                 if(!bPrint)
00225                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00226                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00227         }

00231                 if (bPrint) 
00232                         cout << "KMCBolometerRecord fParentID Not Equal. lhs: " 
00233                         << fParentID << " != rhs " << aRec.fParentID << endl;           
00234                 bIsEqual = false;
00235                 if(!bPrint)
00236                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00237                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00238         }

00276                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure

00284                 bIsEqual = false;
00285                 if(!bPrint)
00286                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00287                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00288         }
